content.title: Uses
content.description: Medium sized thorny plant. Fruits are edible. Phytochemicals present in this plant include: alkaloids, flavonoids, terpenoids, saponin, pectin, triterpenoic acids and lipids. Jujubosides (saponin) isolated is reported to have haemolytic, sedative, anxiolytic and sweetness inhibiting properties. Cyclopeptide alkaloids found to have sedative, antimicrobial, hypoglycaemic, antiplasmodial, anti-infectious, antidiabetic, diuretic, analgesic, anticonvulsant and anti-inflammatory activities.
